intro: Appendiculopsis trifida, commonly known as the three-lobed liverwort, is a small, leafy liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, thalloid structure with a distinct central axis and lateral appendages. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are arranged in a spiral pattern and often have a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Appendiculopsis trifida is primarily found in temperate regions and is an important component of bryophyte communities.
